I'd highly recommend "White Night" for you. This thought-provoking documentary delves into a complex murder mystery that lingers unsolved for over a decade, taking viewers on a captivating journey of suspense and intrigue.

If you're in the mood for something more lighthearted yet still engaging, "Exit Through the Gift Shop" is another great choice! This film takes an entertaining look at the world of street art and the enigmatic relationship between artists and their creations. Enjoy your documentary viewing!

Another intriguing option is "Downfall", a German film that delves into the life of Adolf Hitler's last days, which might appeal to your interest in unconventional narratives. Enjoy exploring these films!

It sounds like you enjoy historical films with a mix of drama and romance! If you haven't already, I highly recommend watching "The King's Speech." This film tells the story of King George VI and his speech therapist who helps him overcome his stammer during a crucial time in British history. The star-studded cast, including Colin Firth as King George VI, delivers captivating performances that are sure to keep you engaged.

Another interesting historical drama is "Invictus," which follows Nelson Mandela's mission to unite South Africa by rallying the national rugby team to win the 1995 Rugby World Cup. This film stars Morgan Freeman as Nelson Mandela and Matt Damon as the captain of the rugby team, providing a powerful portrayal of unity and perseverance in the face of adversity.
